values:
What consists the majority of life? Disappointments? How many years do you need to find 
out the answer?

One thing amazes me that so many music analyses people could adopt Allen Forte 
method wholeheartedly no matter how absurd and obtrusive it leads to, while they 
can't accept a single piece by idea by Rudolf Reti. One out of three people who 
use set theory analyses method is a Martian musician, while anyone who is able to 
apple the Reti method is creative and insightful.

Portrait concert of two young composers from the composition department last night. I know the name itself sounds contradictory, if it is a portrait concert it should be sole of one. The first halve consists two lengthy pieces for two pianos and percussion, and the second half consists all Chinese instrumental solo and chamber works. On the outlook the difference in medium should lead to great contrast between the two, but they actually sound similar, being pentatonic and unsophisticated, somehow to American minimalism. The musicality of both composers are undoubtedly very well. There is fluency throughout. They basically can write works at any scale and character and keep the attraction for listener. And that seems the only merit. Soon I found the music lacks something. Being soundful and interesting is fine, but since I have spent two evening hours in a crowded hall resisting all sorts of disturbance around I want more from the stage. Where is the invention? Anything that could give me a thought? Saying that, I start to worry myself stepping on the same road, composing music fluent and nice but heartless.

Next week I will go to Beijing for a job interview, actually for a post-doctoral position. This can be said a continuation of my last job in China. My mind is splitting, part of myself says don't go, but I keep going unconsciously. It is an adventure, an investment. I will have to suffer two years there in order to go to a better position elsewhere. I do not like China at all, but in Hong Kong there is no way to start my career.
Had a Chinese instrumental quartet piece performed by a professional group, it went brillant. Keep myself composing! Always have interesting finds in Hong Kong.  The revolution is not failed yet!

Watched the film Santa Claus! I went because of Tahar Rahim. The film is just ok, nothing too special but Rahim is always radiating. A professional orchestra called and told me they will perform a work of mine. I am not too exited because I have doubt to that work. If I have enough time I shall write a new one instead of this.

Went to Shenzhen for the Penicillin injection in the morning. I literately found the hospital on the road by chance. Had fever at night, then it seemed getting better. I do hope everything goes as it should. Visited the occupation area in Causeway Bay. I respect those who went forward. Visited the galleries at Central as I do it every two months. Took a mini bus to home after midnight, saw policemen arresting protesting civilians. It feels like war zone. The mini bus driver was incredibly handsome, his back image is made from a mould, the Cantonese kind of muscular beauty. And he drives so smoothly. I wondered why they hired a film star as driver.

Last night in Hong Kong many peaceful protesters in Mongkok were attacked by policemen, blood was shed on the street, people had bone fractures. But they were not threatened and they stayed. This morning when I see the web show hosted by political activists on the street is still on air, my tear almost goes down. Nothing can destroy us, we will regain this city-sate.
I am so worried about Hong Kong. This is a crucial moment for the future of this country-state. I am working in China but I feel myself a foreigner here. All my concern is Hong Kong.
Good trip to Beijing and Seoul, back to Hong Kong for three weeks, go to Shandong again but only for two more month. So many things to do, so little has been done.

Just had a piece for violin and piano performed tonight. The piece is very fine, structure, harmony, intensity, all is at right place. Someone said it is 'romantic', but I never thought of that. My way of thinking is always cold...

I hate discos, I never knew why people go there and do those. I think I went to discos only twice in my life. The first time I was with a man who was trying to seduce me. I was about twenty-one. He got me to the wrong place, I really hated all those things. The second time I went with some schoolmates. I think I was trying to make breakthrough a bit at that time. Being inside I truly had no idea what to do, but when I saw one of my school mate standing there, I patted his shoulders forcefully, in order to show brotherhood. He jumped and panicked. I guess my suddenly act  was beyond brotherly to normal standard.  And for the rest of the night, in fact the whole academic year he was hiding from me, I never saw him again. This is funny.
'Wedding Mass for the composer himself', how brilliant is that when put to program notes. I really need to do this soon.

In Year 2013 I wrote quite a bit, there were art songs, a violin work, a chinese chamber work, and this Sonatina. I wish to have works involving more performers recorded soon, because they sounds really well. Now see this piano work first.
